client_profile: Couple looking to buy an apartment in Brussels. Budget is 770,000–1,055,000 EUR. Priorities include restaurants, central access, and cafes & brunch.
must_have: Availability of cafes and brunch spots
nice_to_have: Close to parks and green spaces
red_flags: High noise levels from nearby bars
Limited public transport options in some districts
Long commute times during peak hours
Risk of budget overruns on property taxes
Potential hidden costs in the buying process
contradictions: Desire for central access may limit budget
Preference for modern amenities vs. older buildings
Cafes might not fit in quieter areas

top_districts.name: Brussels-Capital Region
why: Central location ensures access to top restaurants and cafes.
Strong public transport links facilitate easy commuting.
watch_out: Parking can be a challenge in busy areas.

top_districts.name: Etterbeek
why: Family-friendly parks create a community atmosphere.
Excellent transport links support easy access to the city.
watch_out: Limited parking availability can be an issue.
